revised_title: Enthalpy of Formation of Defects in Non-Stoichiometric Rutile
tldr: The authors calculated the enthalpies of formation of traditional and reconstructed small defects in non-stoichiometric rutile. They found that reconstructed interstitial defects have significantly lower formation enthalpies, confirming previous interpretations of electrical conductivity and high-resolution electron microscopic results. This study helps to resolve the conflict between computational and experimental results in understanding the nature of small defects in rutile.
